page.title: 19GROUNDWATCH
page.content: Groundwatch is an organisation officiated to the Royal Society for Nature Conservations watch groups and is interested in encouraging young people to care about wildlife and their environment in the countryside and in towns. It is run by various members of Rossendale Groundwork plus adult volunteers. Ponds have been dipped in and discoveries have been made of Rossendales very own shrimps, leaches, water crickets, newts, water voles and freshwater sponges. On drier ground a variety of insects, long tailed field mice and badger setts were discovered. In the air red admirals, tortoiseshells and orange tipped butterflies, bats, larks, curlews, lapwings, kestrels and owls have all been spotted.
